text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with buttermilk and brown sugar
meatloaf I know it sounds more like a
coffee cake but it was really good
recipe and let me show you this
I took one large yellow onion and
chopped it up I'm going to saute that in
two tablespoons of butter I want to kind
of translucent a little bit soft but not
browned so I took about six or seven
minutes turn it off let it cool down I
have a two and a half pounds of ground
chuck and here's an important trick take
the tip of a fork I think that's called
the tines I learned that in a crossword
puzzle and you just kind of separate all
those strands of meat and kind of break
it up a little bit and then when we put
our herbs and spices and stuff on there
it mixes in a lot easier you don't have
to over mix it let's spice this up I
have a pinch of tarragon that's dried
tarragon all right I got some
Worcestershire sauce some black pepper
some salt now salt I have a formula I do
it one teaspoon per pound of meat so for
me that was two and a half teaspoons of
salt all right some ketchup very
important for the acidity gives it a
nice color when it's cooked I'm going to
put in my onions on top of the ketchup
because they're still a little warm and
the ketchups cold and now the onions
aren't burning my beef and those are
pretty cool anyway so just make sure
they're not really hot when you put them
in but if they're warm it's okay I'm
going to give a little squirt of hot
sauce the hot sauce of your choice
optional all right a pinch of regular
dry Italian or mix that's got the
rosemary in the marjoram and the thyme
and the you know and I'm going to put
buttermilk the secret ingredient
all right thank you meatloaf that's
going to make it nice and delicious now
I normally put a little milk in my
meatloaf so I thought hey buttermilk
it's tangy low fat let's try it out I'm
going to put two beaten eggs in there
and my bread crumbs the amount of bread
crumbs is crucial you must have the
perfect measurement so you know go to
the site if you're not already there and
all the ingredients are listed we're
going to mix that up with my fork now
you notice my hands have not gotten in
here yet and I know what you're thinking
what's the deal with the fork
I'd like to touch my meatloaf me too so
we're going to touch it when we form it
that way it doesn't get over mixed once
it's mixed we are going to let it sit
and we're going to let the breadcrumbs
suck up a little bit of that moisture
for about 10 minutes
okay just let it sit there and it will
kind of stiffen up a little bit so I'm
going to wet my fingers that will let me
give it a nice smooth finish without it
sticking to my hands and you're going to
shape it into a loaf
[Music]
Thank You meatloaf and I'm going to put
it in a slow oven 325 for 45 minutes all
right and that's just when we're going
to glaze it so in the meantime while
we're waiting for that to cook the first
portion of the cooking we're going to
mix up my brown sugar glaze is just
brown sugar mustard all right and a
little splash of vinegar and after 45
minutes it's still not cook but we're
going to glaze it and so very light
glaze nothing real heavy we're going to
put it back in for a half-hour so it
goes about an hour 15 minutes altogether
internal temperature 160 and what comes
out is so moist and tender and delicious
you're not going to believe it the slow
cooking helps the buttermilk definitely
give it a just a fantastic texture and
taste the somewhat sweet glaze kind of
balances the Tang as the onions the
herbs of spices you know that all works
together
so find yourself some mashed potatoes
